Robert Clayton Dean.Action: Is established as a likable young lawyer with a well-appointed office filled with citations of merit and family pictures, implying professionalism and capability.
Corrects L.T. to say 'Italian-Americans' instead of a slur, showing respect and tolerance.
Calls L.T. 'Bobby' and assures him 'I'm your lawyer. Don't do anything till I talk to you.' Shows personal and sincere support.
Walks a grateful L.T. to the door and sends a case of chianti to Larry Spinks in hospital, indicating kindness and care.
Uses the phrase 'Guido mother-fuckers' himself when frustrated, despite correcting L.T. earlier, showing some inconsistency.
Expresses concern about not breaking the law, seeks reassurance from Rachel.
Politely thanks Rachel after their conversation.
Approaches DePinto calmly with accusations, tries to verify facts rather than aggressively accusing.
Admits possibly jumping the gun when DePinto denies the accusations.
Prioritizes buying a Christmas present (lingerie) for his wife over assisting with demanding work tasks.
Politely redirects Diane's request by reminding her of Mr. Silverberg's suggestion about models trying on garments, demonstrating awareness and social tact.

Politely interacts with sales clerk, shows consideration for wife's preferences in buying lingerie as Christmas gift.
Attempts to navigate an unfamiliar shopping situation by asking for help and admitting lack of expertise while trying to buy lingerie as a gift.

Maintains composure and follows social cues to continue the interaction politely and effectively despite discomfort.

Reacting quietly and solemnly upon seeing the bloody jacket and accident scene.

Interacts playfully and warmly with his family, showing personal confidence and social skill.
Jokes with his son and his son's friend, signaling ease and control in domestic context.

Has large cash withdrawals with no matching purchases, irregular banking patterns flagged by intelligence.

Politely states he did not witness the accident and offers limited but truthful information without hostility.
Maintains a calm and consistent story despite probing questions; does not volunteer false information and deflects appropriately when unsure.
Fails to proactively report witnessing or involvement in the accident despite being mentioned repeatedly, suggesting missed opportunity to assert control.
Encourages Morelos to seek information from the bus driver, showing understanding of roles and boundaries.
Appears somewhat evasive and distracted by unrelated complaint (missing blender) when questioned, indicating possible lack of focus or strategic communication.
Answers questions politely and firmly defends his wife's dignity when Morelos asks inappropriate questions.

Interrupts Morelos and calls out inappropriate behavior openly, demonstrating assertiveness and awareness of boundaries.

Responds to aggressive questioning with insults and anger instead of measured, professional answers.

Admits to Stacy that he lied about seeing Rachel Banks because he didn't want to upset her and insists there's nothing between them.
Denies the authenticity of surveillance photos and tries to reason with Stacy despite her anger and accusations.

Hands another card to the clerk despite initial card decline and embarrassment.
Shows frustration by pounding the ATM machine and swearing, causing people behind him to back away.

Instructs Stacy to take their child and go to his parents’ house to protect them despite personal danger.
